item.title: Applying Bitcoin to the IoT Interoperability Conundrum
item.description:
Applying Bitcoin to the IoT Interoperability Conundrum

One of the main themes of this year's Embedded Linux Conference and OpenIoT Summit was the challenge of bridging the growing number of Internet of Things (IoT) standards. Many speakers were hopeful about the potential for achieving functional interoperability, if not a unifying standard, and there were even calls for a possible merger between two of the largest open source efforts: AllSeen and IoTivity.

item.title: Bitcoin Price $600 Pullback
item.description:
Bitcoin Price $600 Pullback

Bitcoin price has made little progress during the past week and the market is falling away from $600 (Bitstamp). The depth of the downward correction is uncertain and we look for potential support levels. This analysis is provided by xbt.social with a 3-hour delay. Read the full analysis here.

item.title: French Presidential Hopeful Calls for Bitcoin Ban - CoinDesk
item.description:
French Presidential Hopeful Calls for Bitcoin Ban - CoinDesk

The head of a major far-right political party in France has called for ending the use of bitcoin and other digital currencies in the European country.

item.title: Bitcoin Foundation Has a Few Months Left, Recent Gift Not Enough
item.description:
Bitcoin Foundation Has a Few Months Left, Recent Gift Not Enough

A recent Bitcoin Foundation Board of Directors meeting revealed that the organization is on the ropes, with only a few months worth of funding left Also read: Russia's National Cryptocurrency Would Ban Rivals . This news comes after a $55-65 thousand dollar donation Brock Pierce secured from the BitClub mining organization.

item.title: Now that PayPal has left Turkey, Turks should use Bitcoin | Privacy Online News
item.description:
Now that PayPal has left Turkey, Turks should use Bitcoin | Privacy Online News

The nearly 75 million residents of Turkey will be unable to use PayPal to pay for online goods starting June 6th, 2016. PayPal's decision to pull out of Turkey resulted from the expiration of a required financial license. Rather than risk the ire of Turkey's financial regulator, PayPal will withdraw from Turkey.

item.title: Compact Blocks FAQ
item.description:
Compact Blocks FAQ

Compact block relay, BIP152, is a method of reducing the amount of bandwidth used to propagate new blocks to full nodes. Using simple techniques it is possible to reduce the amount of bandwidth necessary to propagate new blocks to full nodes when they already share much of the same mempool contents.

item.title: Egnyte Protects Companies From Local and Cloud-based Ransomware Attacks
item.description:
Egnyte Protects Companies From Local and Cloud-based Ransomware Attacks

Stopping the number of ransomware attacks and data breaches should be the top priority for every enterprise in existence. Egnyte Protect is on the right track, as they offer a brand new service which provides access control and blocks harmful software at the same time.

item.title: Federal Reserve Boardroom Broadcasted Its First Bitcoin Transaction
item.description:
Federal Reserve Boardroom Broadcasted Its First Bitcoin Transaction

Hardly anyone will be surprised the regulatory engagement in the blockchain world is reaching new highs. Hardly anyone ever expected to use the terms Federal Reserve and Bitcoin in the same sentence in a positive manner. As it turns out, the Fed has been quite open to Bitcoin and blockchain as of late, but there is still a lot of work to be done.

item.title: Prison Librarian Purchased Firearm and Cocaine From Deep Web
item.description:
Prison Librarian Purchased Firearm and Cocaine From Deep Web

The deep web appeals to people from all walks of life, including a prison librarian at HMP Brixton. After ordering a Glock 19 handgun and ammunition from a darknet marketplace, he wanted to have the goods delivered to his home. That same address was also used for his drug dealing operation.

item.title: The $1.7 Trillion Reason Banks Prefer Blockchain or Distributed Ledger Over Bitcoin
item.description:
The $1.7 Trillion Reason Banks Prefer Blockchain or Distributed Ledger Over Bitcoin

Banks know Blockchain is a threat to the linchpin of their economics: the customer relationship, and the $1.7 trillion they made in 2014 from global payments revenue which is a massive 40% of their annual profits. Historically the banking industry has provided three main services: financing, investment and transactions.
